result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Scott Quam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven Scott Quam in court.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds it has no authority to vacate DNA surcharge.

Defendant Steven Scott Quam in court.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives attorney freely & voluntarily. Advised rights. Victim compliant. No contest plea entered, court adjudicates guilty. COURT ORDERS: sentence withheld- 18 months probation concurrent to probation serving. Costs $543- bond applied- balance due 12.10.15. Complete DVIP.
Defendant Steven Scott Quam in court.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant Steven Scott Quam in court.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Steven Scott Quam in court.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 1:00pm.
